g:HTMLPanel.div:
Commands are entered on individual lines. Tortue commands and variables are not case-sensitive. The following commands are currently supported by Tortue:
FORWARD
Move forward, producing a line. Example: FORWARD 50
BACKWARD
Move backward, producing a line. Example: BACKWARD 50
LEFT
Rotate the cursor left by an amount of degrees. Example: LEFT 90
RIGHT
Rotate the cursor right by an amount of degrees. Example: RIGHT 90
SETX
Move the cursor to the specified X location Example: SETX 10
SETY
Move the cursor to the specified Y location Example: SETY 70
HOME
Moves the cursor to the center of the screen Example: HOME
PENDOWN
Causes subsequent drawing commands (forward/backward) to be drawn. Example: PENDOWN
PENUP
Causes subsequent drawing commands (forward/backward) to not be drawn. Example: PENUP
PENCOLOR
Change the pen color. Use a color name or specify red, green, blue, and alpha values. Example: PENCOLOR GREEN
PENCOLOR 128 0 128 255
DRAWSTRING
Draw the specified string at the current location. Example: DRAWSTRING Hello World!
FONTNAME
Use the specified font name when drawing messages. Accepts css fonts. Example: FONTNAME SERIF
FONTSIZE
Use the specified font size when drawing messages. Example: FONTSIZE 36
FONTSTYLE
Use the specified style when drawing messages. Accepts css font styles. Example: FONTSTYLE BOLD
CLEAR
Clears the screen. Example: CLEAR
NEW
Starts a new drawing. Example: NEW
SUM
Add two values together and put the result into the specified variable. Example: SUM TEST = 10 + 20
SUBTRACT
Subtract two values and put the result into the specified variable. Example: SUBTRACT TEST = 30 - 10
MULTIPLY
Multiply two values and put the result into the specified variable. Example: MULTIPLY TEST = 20 * 20
DIVIDE
Divide two values and put the result into the specified variable. Example: DIVIDE TEST = 30 / 5
MAKE
Define a variable with the specified value. Example (define variable TEST as 100): MAKE TEST = 100
REPEAT
Repeat all commands until END REPEAT is reached for the specified number of times. Example (to draw a square) : REPEAT 4
FORWARD 50
LEFT 90
END REPEAT
IF
Execute the commands until END IF is reached, if the specified condition is true. Conditions are: = (equals), < (less than), > (greater than), ! (not equal) Example (draw a line if 10 is less than 100) : IF 10 < 100
FORWARD 50
END IF
TO
Define a set of commands that can be called using the specified name. Example (define a command "line", and then call the command): TO LINE
FORWARD 30
END TO
LINE
